Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails - 2 Day Chiang Dao

Experience a completely off the beaten track hiking trail in some of Chiang Mai, Northern Thailand's most beautiful National Parks. Pha Daeng National Park in Chiang Dao. Rich in fauna and flora. Incredibly scenic and non touristic. Here you will hike one of a kind special hiking trails. Hiking 4 hours through the heart of the rain forests. Visit the famous Sticky waterfalls known for its limestone rocks that are sticky due to the mineral deposits from the spring water, views and we will take you to sleep in a hilltribe village, where you can experience village life.

Quick Facts

Price: THB 2,800
Duration: 1 night 2 days
Meal(s): Meals
Difficulty: Medium, has a mix of uphills and downhills
Seasonal: Not available in rainy season (June to September)

More Info

Pick Up & Drop Off

Pick up from your hotel between 7.30 - 8.00 am. Drop off in Chiang Mai around 5.30 - 6.30 pm.

Included

Pick up and drop off from your hotel, meals, 2 liters of water, English-speaking guide, park fees, insurance, accommodation and necessary bedding, blankets etc.

Not Included

Extra snacks or soft drinks.

What to Bring

Wear shoes with grip suitable for trekking and climbing, swimsuit for enjoying at the waterfall and pack a warm layer, mornings can be chilly at the summit. Bring toothbrush, toothpaste and any other necessities for an overnight stay.

Please support our mission by booking your trek directly with us on this site or by calling us instead of through a tour agency.

Highlights

  • Explore Pha Daeng National Park
  • Trek a special trail through the jungle
  • Visit Sticky waterfalls
  • Stay overnight in hilltribe village

Itinerary:

  • Day 1: Pick up 7.30 - 8.00 am from hotel, drive 2 hours stop at local market to get supplies along the way.
  • Start trek at Hui Kor Ethnic Hilltribe Village, we will hike 3 hours through the National Park enjoying the views along the trail and the diversity of the rainforest and jungles. Learn about all the different plants along the trail.
  • We will arrive in a small ethnic hilltribe village where we will be sleeping for the night, you will have time to explore the village and see the woman do their traditional weaving.
  • In the evening you can cook dinner with your guide and watch the local children do their traditional dance and song.
  • Day 2: Have breakfast and then we will hike another 3 hours through the rainforest.
  • Stopping for lunch along the trail
  • Arrive at the end of the trail and drive 1 hour to sticky waterfalls where you will spend some time enjoying the falls.
  • Depart for Chiang Mai arriving back around 17.30.

Notes:

Please note that trails and stops may change due to weather and seasonal conditions, or depending on fitness levels of the group.
